$$
P(x) = x^{2001} + \left(\frac{1}{2} - x\right)^{2001}
$$

  $$

$$
\text{Sum of roots} = -\frac{\text{coefficient of } x^{1999}}{\text{coefficient of } x^{2000}} = -\left( \frac{-2001 \cdot 2000 / 8}{2001 / 2} \right)
$$

Simplifying:

$$

$$

$$

Since the polynomial is of degree 2000, and each pair contributes 1/2 to the total sum, the total number of such pairs is 1000, and the total sum is:

$$
1000 \cdot \frac{1}{2} = 500
$$
